title: How to Copy Multiple Links at Once

steps.title: Install Copy Selected Links on your browser.
steps.content: Install Copy Selected Links on your browser. Copy Selected Links is a free web browser extension that can copy multiple URLs to your clipboard at once. It works by extracting links from text you've selected. Chrome: Go to https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/copy-selected-links/kddpiojgkjnpmgiegglncafdpnigcbij?hl=en in Chrome and click the blue Add to Chrome button. Click Add Extension to confirm. Firefox: Go to https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/copy-selected-links and click the blue +Add to Firefox button. Click Add to confirm.

steps.title: Highlight any text with links using your mouse.
steps.content: Highlight any text with links using your mouse. Click and drag the mouse to select any text that contains at least one link. It's okay if you select other text, too—only the links will be copied. To select all text on a page, hold down the Control (PC) or Command key and press the A key at the same time.

steps.title: Right-click the highlighted text.
steps.content: Right-click the highlighted text. A context menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Copy Selected Links on the menu.
steps.content: Click Copy Selected Links on the menu. This copies just the URLs from the selected text to your clipboard.

steps.title: Paste the copied URLs into the desired location.
steps.content: Paste the copied URLs into the desired location. Now that the URLs are copied, you can paste them by right-clicking a text file or other typing area and selecting Paste .

steps.title: Install the LinkClump extension for Chrome.
steps.content: Install the LinkClump extension for Chrome. LinkClump makes it easy to select and copy multiple links on a single page. You can also configure the extension to automatically open the selected links in individual browser tabs, bookmark the links, or open them all in new windows. To install LinkClump: Go to https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/linkclump/lfpjkncokllnfokkgpkobnkbkmelfefj in Chrome. Click the blue Add to Chrome button in the upper-right corner. Click Add extension to confirm. Once the extension is installed, a vegetal icon will be added to the icon bar in the upper-right area of Chrome.

steps.title: Click the LinkClump icon in Chrome.
steps.content: Click the LinkClump icon in Chrome. It looks like a clump of weeds or vegetables. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Options on the menu.
steps.content: Click Options on the menu. This opens your LinkClump preferences.

steps.title: Click the Add Action button.
steps.content: Click the Add Action button. It's at the bottom of the "Actions" section. LinkClump comes with one action—if you press and hold the Z key as you draw a selection box around some links, it will open all of the links in individual tabs. If you don't want this action, click Delete below it.

steps.title: Choose a key and mouse combination.
steps.content: Choose a key and mouse combination. In the top section, choose which mouse button you want to use to draw the box. Then, select the keyboard key you want to press at the same time to activate LinkClump. For example, if you want to be able to copy all links by holding down the C key as you draw a box with the left mouse button, select Left and C . You can also choose a color for the box you draw by clicking the default color (pink) and selecting an alternative.

steps.title: Select Copied to clipboard under "Action."
steps.content: Select Copied to clipboard under "Action." This is what tells LinkClump to copy the links rather than do something else with them. The "Advanced Options" section has other options that may appeal to you, including the option to skip or include links containing certain words.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Now that you've saved your key combination, you can start using LinkClump.

steps.title: Draw a box around the links you want to copy.
steps.content: Draw a box around the links you want to copy. Remember to use the key combination you created earlier. As soon as you lift your fingers from the keys/mouse, the links will be copied to your clipboard, ready to paste.

steps.title: Paste the links into the desired location.
steps.content: Paste the links into the desired location. To paste the copied links, just right-click the typing area where you'd like them to appear and select Paste .
